block-definition.translations: de:fange _ _ ca:agafa _ _ es:atrapar _ _ fr:attrape _ _ pt:captura _ _
de:wirf _ ca:llança _ es:lanzar _ fr:lance _ pt:lança _
de:fange _ _ ca:agafa _ _ es:atrapar _ _ fr:attrape _ _ pt:captura _ _
de:wirf _ _ ca:llança _ _ es:lanzar _ _ fr:lance _ _ pt:lança _ _

de:falls _ dann _ und pause $pause-1-255-220-0 ca:si _ fes _ i atura-ho tot $pause-1-255-220-0 es:si _ haz _ y páralo todo $pause-1-255-220-0 fr:si _ faire _ et mettre tout en pause $pause-1-255-220-0 pt:se _ , então _ e faz pausa em tudo $pause-1-255-220-0
de:ignoriere _ ca:ignora _ es:ignorar _ fr:ignore _ pt:ignora _

block-definition.comment: Call f(f(f(...(f(x))))) n times where the three input slots are n, f, and x from left to right. The # variable can be used inside f to represent how many times f has been called.
block-definition.translations: pt:o resultado de _ invocações em cascata de _ com argumento inicial _ _

block-definition.comment: Call f(f(f(...(f(x))))) until condition is true, where the three input slots are condition, f, and x from left to right. The # variable can be used inside f or condition to indicate how many times f has been called.
block-definition.translations: pt:o resultado da invocação em cascata até que _ de _ com argumento inicial _ _

block-definition.comment: Returns the function f(g(x)) where f and g are the two inputs.
block-definition.translations: pt:a composição de _ com _

block-definition.comment: Like the built-in REPEAT UNTIL block, except that the ending condition is not tested until the script has been run the first time. So the script is run at least once.
block-definition.translations: pt:repete _ até que _ $loop-0.7

block-definition.comment: Run the script repeatedly, as long as the given condition is true. Runs the script at least once before testing the condition.
block-definition.translations: pt:repete _ enquanto _ $loop-0.7

block-definition.comment: Runs the script repeatedly, as long as the condition is true. Tests the condition before the first time the script is run. Like the built in REPEAT UNTIL except that in this block the condition must be true, not false.
block-definition.translations: pt:enquanto _ , repete _ $loop-0.7

block-definition.comment: Runs the script the specified number of times, like the built-in REPEAT block, but this one provides the # variable that can be used inside the script. Try REPEAT (200) MOVE (#) STEPS RIGHT 92 with the pen down.
block-definition.translations: pt:repete _ vezes _ _ $loop-0.7
pt:para _ de _ com passo _ a _ _ $loop-0.7

block-definition.comment: Provides LOOP as a function of one input that runs the body of the LET with A set to the function input, so the body can run itself recursively. See COPY block in Variables for an example of use.
block-definition.translations: pt:tendo _ o valor inicial _ , executa _ definido como _
pt:os dados JSON _ em formato de lista

block.l: return listify(JSON.parse(jsonString)); function listify(jsonObject) { if (jsonObject instanceof Array) { return new List(jsonObject.map(function(eachElement) { return listify(eachElement)})); } else if (jsonObject instanceof Object) { return new List(Object.keys(jsonObject).map(function(eachKey) { return new List([eachKey,listify(jsonObject[eachKey])])} )) } else { return jsonObject } }

block-definition.translations: pt:o valor com chave _ em _

custom-block.s: SDL next signal from input queue

block-definition.s: SDL next signal from input queue
SDL send signal %'signal' to %'agent' delay %'delay' param %'param'

block-definition.comment: rectangle(x, y, width, height, R, G, B)

block.l: stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph); let ctx = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'); let decColor = Math.pow(2,16)*parseInt(R)+Math.pow(2,8)*parseInt(G)+parseInt(B); let hexColor = decColor.toString(16); let lpadHexColor = ("000000" + hexColor).slice(-6) ctx.fillStyle='#'+lpadHexColor; let dx = ctx.canvas.width/2; let dy = ctx.canvas.height/2; ctx.fillRect(parseInt(x)+dx, -parseInt(y)+dy, width, -height); stage.changed();

block-definition.comment: text(x, y, text, R, G, B, font) font: <pixels>px font-family

block.l: let stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph); let ctx = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'); let decColor = Math.pow(2,16)*parseInt(R)+Math.pow(2,8)*parseInt(G)+parseInt(B); let hexColor = decColor.toString(16); let lpadHexColor = ("000000" + hexColor).slice(-6) ctx.fillStyle='#'+lpadHexColor; ctx.font = font; ctx.fillStyle='#'+lpadHexColor; let dx = ctx.canvas.width/2; let dy = ctx.canvas.height/2; ctx.fillText(text, parseInt(x)+dx+1, -parseInt(y)+dy-1); stage.changed();

block-definition.comment: circle(x, y, radius, R, G, B)

block.l: let stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph); let ctx = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'); let decColor = Math.pow(2,16)*parseInt(R)+Math.pow(2,8)*parseInt(G)+parseInt(B); let hexColor = decColor.toString(16); let lpadHexColor = ("000000" + hexColor).slice(-6) ctx.beginPath(); let dx = ctx.canvas.width/2; let dy = ctx.canvas.height/2; ctx.arc(parseInt(x)+dx+parseInt(radius), -parseInt(y)+dy-parseInt(radius), radius, 0, 2*Math.PI); ctx.fillStyle='#'+lpadHexColor; ctx.fill(); ctx.strokeStyle='#'+lpadHexColor; ctx.stroke(); stage.changed();

block-definition.comment: Reports a sorted version of the list in its first input slot, using the comparison function in the second input slot. For a list of numbers, using < as the comparison function will sort from low to high; using > will sort from high to low.
block-definition.translations: ca:ordena _ segons criteri _

block-definition.comment: Throw an error. Makes a red halo appear around the script that runs it, with the input text shown in a speech balloon next to the script, just like any Snap! error. This is useful to put in the second script of SAFELY TRY after some other instructions to undo the partial work of the first script.
block-definition.translations: pt:lança o erro _

block-definition.s: safely try reporting %'this' then if %'error' report %'that'
block-definition.comment: Catch errors in a reporter. Evaluates its first input. If that expression successfully reports a value, this block reports that value. If the expression causes a Snap! error, then the final input slot is evaluated with the text of what would have been the error message in variable ERROR. SAFELY TRY then reports the value of that final expression. Sometimes you'll want to throw an error in the final expression. You can put an ERROR block inside a CALL block to do that.
block-definition.translations: ca:prova de forma segura reportant _ i si _ reportant _

block-definition.s: load JS from url: %'url' waiting for object: %'object'

block.l: var nodes = document.getElementsByTagName('*'), node = nodes[nodes.length - 1].parentNode, script = document.createElement('script'); if (object == null) { throw new Error( 'You need to specify the name of an object that you expect the library to create.' ); } script.id = object.replace(/[^a-z]/gi,''); if (!document.getElementById(script.id)) { script.setAttribute('type', 'text/javascript'); script.setAttribute('src', url); node.appendChild(script); }

/* github.com/pixavier/mqtt4snap */ broker = broker ? broker.trim() : broker; username = username ? username.trim() : username; password = password ? password.trim() : password; stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph); if (!('mqtt' in stage)){ stage.mqtt = []; } let wsbroker; if (broker.startsWith('ws://')) { wsbroker = broker; } else if (broker.startsWith('wss://')) { wsbroker = broker; } else { let prefix; prefix = window.location.protocol == 'https:'?'wss':'ws'; wsbroker = prefix + '://' + broker; } if(!stage.mqtt[broker]){ if (username) { stage.mqtt[broker] = mqtt.connect(wsbroker, { username: username, password: password, // reconnectPeriod: -1 }); }else{ stage.mqtt[broker] = mqtt.connect(wsbroker); } stage.mqtt[broker].on('connect', function(connack) { process.doSetVar('connection status', 'connected'); console.log('Connected to ' + wsbroker); }); stage.mqtt[broker].on('close', function() { console.log('Connection closed on ' + wsbroker); try{ stage.mqtt[broker].end(); }catch(e){} delete stage.mqtt[broker]; }); stage.mqtt[broker].on('error', function(error) { console.log('error', error.message); try{ stage.mqtt[broker].end(); }catch(e){} delete stage.mqtt[broker]; }); }else{ console.log('Already connected to ' + wsbroker); process.doSetVar('connection status', 'connected'); }

/* github.com/pixavier/mqtt4snap */ broker = broker ? broker.trim() : broker; topic = topic ? ('' + topic).trim() : '' + topic; let payload = msg ? ('' + msg).trim() : ''; let stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph); if (!('mqtt' in stage)){throw new Error('No connection to broker ' + broker);} if(!stage.mqtt[broker]){throw new Error('No connection to broker ' + broker);} try{ let client = stage.mqtt[broker]; client.publish(topic, payload); }catch(e){ // console.log(e); throw e; }

/* github.com/pixavier/mqtt4snap */ broker = broker ? broker.trim() : broker; topic = topic ? topic.trim() : topic; let stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph); if (!('mqtt' in stage)){throw new Error('No connection to broker '+broker);} if (!stage.mqtt[broker]){throw new Error('No connection to broker '+broker);} stage.mqtt[broker].subscribe(topic); let prefix = window.location.protocol == 'https:'?'wss':'ws'; let wsbroker = prefix+'://'+broker; let mqttListener = function (aTopic, payload) { if (!mqttWildcard(aTopic, topic)) {return;} let p = new Process(); try { p.initializeFor(callback, new List([aTopic, payload.toString()])); } catch(e) { p.initializeFor(callback, new List([])); } stage.threads.processes.push(p); }; mqttListener.topic = topic; stage.mqtt[broker].on('message', mqttListener); let mqttWildcard = function (topic, wildcard) { if (topic === wildcard) {return true;} else if (wildcard === '#') {return true;} var res = []; var t = String(topic).split('/'); var w = String(wildcard).split('/'); var i = 0; for (var lt = t.length; i < lt; i++) { if (w[i] === '+') { res.push(t[i]); } else if (w[i] === '#') { res.push(t.slice(i).join('/')); return true; } else if (w[i] !== t[i]) { return false; } } if (w[i] === '#') {i += 1;} return (i === w.length) ? true : false; }

/* github.com/pixavier/mqtt4snap */ let stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph); try{ stage.mqtt[broker].unsubscribe(topic); // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/64776550/mqtt-js-after-unscbribe-still-receive-messages-from-old-listener // https://github.com/mqttjs/async-mqtt/issues/31 let listeners = stage.mqtt[broker].listeners('message'); listeners.forEach((listener) => { if (topic == listener.topic || topic == '#') { stage.mqtt[broker].removeListener('message', listener); } }); }catch(e){ console.log(e); }

/* github.com/pixavier/mqtt4snap */ let stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph); try{ if(broker=='all'){ for(let brok of Object.keys(stage.mqtt)){ try { stage.mqtt[brok].end(); } catch (e0) { console.log(e0); } } }else{ if (stage.mqtt[broker]) { stage.mqtt[broker].end(); } } }catch(e1){ console.log(e1); } try{ if(broker=='all'){ try { delete stage.mqtt; stage.mqtt=[]; } catch (e2) { // console.log(e2); } }else{ delete stage.mqtt[broker]; } }catch(e3){ // console.log(e3); }

custom-block.s: load JS from url: %s waiting for object: %s

block-definition.comment: Catch errors. Runs the first script. If it succeeds, nothing else happens. But if it has an error (something that would otherwise result in a red halo around the block), then the second script is run, with the text of the error message that would have been shown in the variable ERROR.
block-definition.translations: pt:tenta executar _ e, em caso de erro _ , executa _ ca:prova de forma segura _ i si _ _
pt:o texto multilinha _ ca:multilínia _

block-definition.comment: Reports the part of the first string up to the first instance of the second string inside it. If the second string isn't found, reports the entire first string.
block-definition.translations: pt:o texto de _ antes de _ ca:part del text _ anterior a _

custom-block.s: substring of %txt from position %n to position %n inclusive

block-definition.comment: Reports the portion of the first input string starting after the first occurrence of the second string. If the second string isn't found in the first string, reports an empty string.
block-definition.translations: pt:o texto de _ depois de _ ca:part del text _ posterior a _

custom-block.s: substring of %txt from position %n to position %n inclusive

block-definition.comment: Reports the character position (starting from 1) of the beginning of the first input string inside the second input string. If it's not found, reports 0.
block-definition.translations: pt:a posição de _ em _ ca:posició de _ en _

block-definition.comment: If input is TRUE, comparisons made by functions in the string library will be case-independent (so "FOO" = "foo"). This is the default. If input is FALSE, comparisons will be exact.
block-definition.translations: pt:altera comparações ignorando distinção minúsculas/maiúsculas para _ ca:ignora la diferenciació de majúscules _

block-definition.s: substring of %'str' from position %'start' to position %'end' inclusive
block-definition.comment: Reports the portion of the first input (string) starting at the position given by the second input (counting from 1, like LETTER n OF) and ending at the position given by the third input (also counting from 1). If the third input is empty, reports the portion from the first position to the end of the string. If a position number is negative, counts from the end backward, so -1 is the last character, -2 is the next to last, etc.
block-definition.translations: pt:o texto de _ entre as posições _ e _ , inclusive ca:part del text _ des de la posició _ fins _

block-definition.comment: Reports True if the first input string contains the second input string, otherwise false. Comparison is case-independent by default; use USE CASE-INDEPENDENT COMPARISONS to change that.
block-definition.translations: pt:o texto de _ antes de _ ca:text _ conté _ ?

block-definition.comment: Reports the input text with lower case letters instead of capital letters in the input. Uses the user's locale's rules for case conversion.
block-definition.translations: pt:em minúsculas _ ca:_ a minúscules
ca:comparacions ignorant majúscules?

block-definition.s: enable move custom block to top

block.l: if( !CustomCommandBlockMorph.prototype._userMenu){ CustomCommandBlockMorph.prototype._userMenu = CustomCommandBlockMorph.prototype.userMenu; } CustomCommandBlockMorph.prototype.userMenu = function(){ var shiftClicked = world.currentKey === 16 ,menu = this._userMenu(); menu.addItem( "move block to top", function (){ var rcvr = this.scriptTarget(), ide = this.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), def = this.isGlobal ? this.definition : rcvr.getMethod(this.blockSpec), spec = def.spec; if (this.isGlobal) { ide.stage.globalBlocks = ide.stage.globalBlocks.filter(item => item !== def); ide.stage.globalBlocks.unshift(def); } else { rcvr.customBlocks = rcvr.customBlocks.filter(item => item !== def); rcvr.customBlocks.unshift(def); } ide.flushPaletteCache(); ide.refreshPalette(); ide.recordUnsavedChanges(); } ); return menu; }

if( !CustomReporterBlockMorph.prototype._userMenu){ CustomReporterBlockMorph.prototype._userMenu = CustomReporterBlockMorph.prototype.userMenu; } CustomReporterBlockMorph.prototype.userMenu = function(){ var shiftClicked = world.currentKey === 16 ,menu = this._userMenu(); menu.addItem( "move block to top", function (){ var rcvr = this.scriptTarget(), ide = this.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), def = this.isGlobal ? this.definition : rcvr.getMethod(this.blockSpec), spec = def.spec; if (this.isGlobal) { ide.stage.globalBlocks = ide.stage.globalBlocks.filter(item => item !== def); ide.stage.globalBlocks.unshift(def); } else { rcvr.customBlocks = rcvr.customBlocks.filter(item => item !== def); rcvr.customBlocks.unshift(def); } ide.flushPaletteCache(); ide.refreshPalette(); ide.recordUnsavedChanges(); } ); return menu; }

block-definition.comment: This block creates new variables on the selected scope: global (for all sprites), sprite (for this sprite only) or script (only for that blocks stack) with the names given (in 'names' list). If there is already a variable with that name in that scope, it does nothing: no errors and no overwrites.
block-definition.translations: pt:cria as variáveis _ _ ca:crea les _ variables _ es:crear las _ variables _ de:erstellen _ var _

block-definition.comment: This block deletes all the variables with the names given (inside input list). Each name will make only one variable deletion, and this will be the variable found following the scope order: 'script' -> 'sprite' -> 'global'. If we have a "testing" sprite variable and also a "testing" global one, deleting "testing" will delete only the sprite one (Yes! we can also do "delete var (testing, testing)" to delete both. If one variable does not exists (in any scope) an error happens, stopping block action in that point. You can check it before with the "does var (name) exists?"block.
block-definition.translations: pt:remove as variáveis _ ca:esborra les variables _ es:borrar variables _ de:löschen var _

block-definition.comment: This block sets the given value (last input) to the variable named with the name givent (var input). It looks for that variable following the scope order 'script' -> 'sprite' -> 'global' (the first match it finds). If that variable does not exist (in any scope) an error happens, stopping their script. You can check it before using the "does var (name) exists?" block.
block-definition.translations: ca:assigna a _ el valor _ es:asignar a _ el valor _ pt:altera _ para _ de:setze var _ auf _

block-definition.comment: This block reports the value of the variable with the name given. It looks for that variable following the scope order 'script' -> 'sprite' -> 'global' (the first match it finds). If that variable does not exist (in any scope) an error happens, stopping their script. You can check it before using the "does var (name) exists?" block.
block-definition.translations: pt:o valor de _

block-definition.comment: This block reports "true" if there is a variable with this given name (input slot) in that context. It can be a global, sprite or script variable. Otherwise it reports "false".
block-definition.translations: pt:a variável _ existe ca:existeix la variable _ ? es:existe la variable _ ? de:existiert var _ ?

block-definition.comment: This block turns on (show) the watcher view on stage (if it was not already activated) of the variable with the given name (slot input). It can only access to the closest variable scope (if there different variables with the same name in different scopes) following the order 'script' -> 'sprite' -> 'global'. No errors if that variable does not exist.
block-definition.translations: ca:mostra la variable _ es:mostrar variable _ pt:mostra a variável _ de:zeige var _

block-definition.comment: This block turns off (hide) the watcher view on stage (if it was not already activated) of the variable with the given name (slot input). It can only access to the closest variable scope (if there different variables with the same name in different scopes) following the order 'script' -> 'sprite' -> 'global'. No errors if that variable does not exist.
block-definition.translations: ca:amaga la variable _ es:esconder variable _ pt:esconde a variável _ de:verstecke var _

custom-block.s: SDL send signal %s to %s delay %s param %s
SDL send signal %s to %s delay %s param %s
SDL send signal %s to %s delay %s param %s
SDL send signal %s to %s delay %s param %s
SDL send signal %s to %s delay %s param %s
